intro: Galium sylvestre subsp. mollugo, commonly known as bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it is known for its aromatic scent when crushed. Galium sylvestre subsp. mollugo is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and along stream banks.
